Definition at line 1321 of file n_network.c.

References netw_accept_from_ex().

Here is the call graph for this function:

NETWORK * netw_accept_from_ex ( NETWORK *  from,
int  disable_naggle,
int  sock_send_buf,
int  sock_recv_buf,
int  send_list_limit,
int  recv_list_limit,
int  non_blocking,
int *  retval 
)

make a normal 'accept' . Network 'from' must be allocated with netw_make_listening.

Parameters:
fromthe network from where we accept
disable_naggleDisable Naggle Algorithm. Set to 1 do activate, 0 or negative to leave defaults
sock_send_bufNETW_SOCKET_SEND_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
sock_recv_bufNETW_SOCKET_RECV_BUF socket parameter , 0 or negative to leave defaults
send_list_limitInternal sending list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
recv_list_limitInternal receiving list maximum number of item. 0 or negative for unrestricted
non_blockingset to -1 to make it non blocking, to 0 for blocking, else it's the select timeout value in mseconds.
retvalEAGAIN ou EWOULDBLOCK or errno
Returns:
NULL on failure, if not a pointer to the connected network

int netw_connect ( NETWORK **  netw,
char *  host,
char *  port,
int  ip_version 
)

Use this to connect a NETWORK to any listening one, with following defaults: disable_naggle = 0 , untouched sockbufsendsize and sockbufrecvsize and unrestricted sned/recv lists.

Parameters:
netwa NETWORK *object
hostHost or IP to connect to
portPort to use to connect
ip_versionNETWORK_IPALL for both ipv4 and ipv6 , NETWORK_IPV4 or NETWORK_IPV6
Returns:
TRUE or FALSE

Make a NETWORK be a Listening network.

int netw_set_timers ( NETWORK *  netw,
int  send_queue_wait,
int  send_queue_consecutive_wait,
int  pause_wait 
)

set the timers used when activating threaded network

Parameters:
netwNetwork to tune
send_queue_waitTime between each send_queue check if last call wasn't sending anything
send_queue_consecutive_waitTime between each send_queue check if last call was a sending one
pause_waitTime between each state check when network is paused
Returns:
TRUE or FALSE

Definition at line 573 of file n_network.c.

int netw_setsockopt ( SOCKET  sock,
int  disable_naggle,
int  sock_send_buf,
int  sock_recv_buf 
)

Modify common socket options. Enable SO_REUSEADDR.

Parameters:
sockThe socket to configure
disable_naggleSet to positive to enable. Set to negative to force disable, 0 untouched
sock_send_bufIf >0, then try to set the socket send buffer size in octet
sock_recv_bufIf >0, then try to set the socket recv buffer size in octet
Returns:
TRUE or FALSE

N_STR * netw_wait_msg ( NETWORK *  netw,
long  refresh,
long  timeout 
)

Wait a message from aimed NETWORK. Recheck each usec until a valid.

Parameters:
netwThe link on which we wait a message
refreshThe time in usec between each check until there is a message
timeoutin usecs , maximum amount of time to wait before return. Pass a value <= 0 to disable.
Returns:
NULL or a filled N_STR
